meanings.definition: Of or relating to the eye or vision.
meanings.sent1: The optic nerve carries signals from the eye to the brain.
meanings.sent2: The doctor recommended optic glasses for better vision.
meanings.sent3: The optic exam was a sight to behold, with all the colorful charts.
meanings.sent4: Her optimism was like an optic filter, coloring everything she saw.
meanings.sent5: The optic view of the sunset was breathtaking, painting the sky in hues of orange and pink.

meanings.definition: A device or instrument that aids in vision or sight.
meanings.sent1: He used an optic to magnify the tiny details of the painting.
meanings.sent2: The binoculars were a helpful optic for bird watching.
meanings.sent3: The optic was so powerful, it made everything look closer than it actually was.
meanings.sent4: Her camera was an optic capturing memories in a single frame.
meanings.sent5: The optic in his hand allowed him to see the stars up close, revealing their beauty.
